entry.title: The Best Sourdough Truffle Toast Recipe: A Simple, Vegan Delight
entry.summary:
If you're looking for an easy, yet deliciously indulgent vegan recipe, this Sourdough Truffle Toast is exactly what you need! This simple yet flavorful dish is inspired by a personal experience I had during the holiday season in Tampa, FL a few years ago. I stopped by a local vegan café and tried a gluten-free bagel topped with cashew cheese, truffle oil, and a sprinkle of nutritional yeast. It was a game-changer—so simple, yet so delicous. Since then, I’ve recreated it with a twist, using toasted sourdough for that irresistible crunchy texture.

This recipe is proof that simple vegan recipes can still be incredibly tasty and packed with flavor. With just a handful of ingredients, this truffle toast is not only easy to make but also nutritious and satisfying. Whether you’re a seasoned plant-based eater or just looking to try something new, this toast will quickly become a favorite in your kitchen.
entry.content:
If you're looking for an easy, yet deliciously indulgent vegan recipe, this Sourdough Truffle Toast is exactly what you need! This simple yet flavorful dish is inspired by a personal experience I had during the holiday season in Tampa, FL a few years ago. I stopped by a local vegan café and tried a gluten-free bagel topped with cashew cheese, truffle oil, and a sprinkle of nutritional yeast. It was a game-changer—so simple, yet so delicous. Since then, I’ve recreated it with a twist, using toasted sourdough for that irresistible crunchy texture.

This recipe is proof that simple vegan recipes can still be incredibly tasty and packed with flavor. With just a handful of ingredients, this truffle toast is not only easy to make but also nutritious and satisfying. Whether you’re a seasoned plant-based eater or just looking to try something new, this toast will quickly become a favorite in your kitchen.

Why You'll Love This Sourdough Truffle Toast Recipe:

  • Quick and Easy: Ready in under 10 minutes, making it perfect for breakfast, lunch, or a quick snack.
  • Vegan and Dairy-Free: This recipe is entirely plant-based, ideal for vegans or anyone looking to cut down on dairy.
  • Rich in Flavor: The creamy cashew cheese, earthy truffle oil, and cheesy flavor of nutritional yeast create a perfect blend of flavors.
  • Nutrient-Packed: Nutritional yeast adds essential B vitamins, making this a delicious and healthy choice.

Pro Tips for Perfect Sourdough Truffle Toast:

  • Use high-quality truffle oil: Truffle oil is a key ingredient in this recipe, so make sure to choose a high-quality option. A little goes a long way, so you only need a small drizzle.
  • Customize your toast: Add some crushed nuts, seeds, or even fresh herbs like parsley or chives for an extra layer of flavor and texture.
  • Gluten-free option: If you're gluten-free, you can easily swap out the sourdough for a gluten-free bread or bagel.

Health Benefits of Sourdough Truffle Toast:

This vegan sourdough truffle toast is not only delicious but also packed with nutrients:

  • Cashew cheese is rich in healthy fats and provides a creamy, dairy-free alternative to traditional cheese.
  • Nutritional yeast is a great source of B vitamins, especially B12, which is important for energy and overall health.
  • Truffle oil adds an indulgent flavor while being lower in calories compared to traditional butter or cheese-based toppings.

Why This Sourdough Truffle Toast Recipe is a Must-Try:

  • Easy Vegan Recipe: With just a few simple ingredients, this toast comes together in minutes, making it an ideal option for a quick meal or snack.
  • Perfect for Any Occasion: Whether you’re looking for a light breakfast, a satisfying snack, or something to serve to guests, this truffle toast is sure to impress.
  • Flavor-Packed and Nutritious: You don’t have to sacrifice flavor for health with this dish. It’s creamy, rich, savory, and good for you!

Frequently Asked Questions:

Can I use another type of oil instead of truffle oil? While truffle oil adds a distinct and luxurious flavor, you can substitute it with olive oil for a simpler version. However, truffle oil truly elevates this recipe to another level. I love this White Truffle Oil!

Can I make this recipe gluten-free? Absolutely! Just replace the sourdough bread with your favorite gluten-free bread or bagel.

What can I use instead of cashew cheese? If you're looking for a nut-free option, you can use a store-bought vegan cream cheese or make a homemade seed-based cheese.

Final Thoughts

This Sourdough Truffle Toast is a simple yet luxurious vegan recipe that’s perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a flavorful, plant-based meal. Whether you’re recreating a cozy café experience at home or trying something new, this toast is sure to become a staple. Give it a try, and don’t forget to savor every bite of this indulgent, healthy treat!

For more easy vegan recipes and tips, be sure to check out my other posts!

Ingredients for the Best Sourdough Truffle Toast:

  • 1 slice of sourdough bread (toasted to perfection)
  • 2 tablespoons of cashew cheese
  • 1 teaspoon nutritional yeast
  • Salt (I used this smoked salt)
  • Pepper to taste
  • ½ teaspoon truffle oil (a little goes a long way)

How to Make Sourdough Truffle Toast:

  1. Toast your sourdough bread: Start by toasting your slice of sourdough bread until it's golden brown and crisp. A good quality sourdough will give your toast a slightly tangy flavor and chewy texture.
  2. Spread the cashew cheese: Generously spread 2 tablespoons of creamy cashew cheese on top of the toasted bread. The cashew cheese provides a delicious, dairy-free base for your toast.
  3. Add nutritional yeast: Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of nutritional yeast evenly over the cashew cheese. Nutritional yeast adds a cheesy, nutty flavor that perfectly complements the richness of the truffle oil.
  4. Season with salt and pepper: Lightly season the toast with a pinch of salt and freshly ground black pepper for added flavor.
  5. Drizzle with truffle oil: Finish by drizzling a small amount of truffle oil over the top. The truffle oil adds a luxurious, earthy aroma and elevates the flavors to the next level.
  6. Serve immediately: Enjoy your sourdough truffle toast fresh and warm for the best flavor and texture!

entry.title: Moist Vegan Chocolate Chip Pumpkin Bread
entry.summary:
This moist and fluffy vegan pumpkin bread is bursting with warm pumpkin spice and loaded with rich chocolate and white chocolate chips, making every bite a deliciously sweet treat!

This loaf is guaranteed to win over any pumpkin spice skeptic! It's nearly impossible to stop at just one slice.

The blend of brown sugar, pumpkin, non-dairy buttermilk, and olive oil creates an irresistibly soft and fluffy texture. I experimented with different variations, like using maple syrup, less sugar, less oil, and egg replacers, but those tweaks always led to a drier loaf. This version is the clear winner!
entry.content:
This moist and fluffy vegan pumpkin bread is bursting with warm pumpkin spice and loaded with rich chocolate and white chocolate chips, making every bite a deliciously sweet treat!

This loaf is guaranteed to win over any pumpkin spice skeptic! It's nearly impossible to stop at just one slice.

The blend of brown sugar, pumpkin, non-dairy buttermilk, and olive oil creates an irresistibly soft and fluffy texture. I experimented with different variations, like using maple syrup, less sugar, less oil, and egg replacers, but those tweaks always led to a drier loaf. This version is the clear winner!

Equipment
1-pound loaf pan (I recommend this one)

Ingredients
118ml soy milk 
1½ teaspoons apple cider vinegar
250g canned pumpkin puree (make sure it’s not pumpkin pie filling)
200g coconut sugar
118ml olive oil 
1 Tablespoon vanilla extract
250g Spelt flour
2½ teaspoons baking powder
½ teaspoon baking soda
1 Tablespoon pumpkin spice mix 
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
¼ teaspoon sea salt
50g chocolate chips (I used these)
50g white chocolate chips (I used these)

Instructions
Tip: For the best results, use a digital scale and measure ingredients in grams.


Preheat the oven: Set your oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a 1-pound loaf pan with oil or vegan butter.

Mix the wet ingredients: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the soy milk, pumpkin puree, olive oil, and vanilla extract until smooth and well combined.

Mix the dry ingredients: In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, coconut sugar, baking powder, baking soda, pumpkin spice mix, cinnamon, and salt.

Prepare the batter: Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients in two parts. Gently fold the mixture after each addition until no dry pockets remain. Be careful not to over mix. Once combined, fold in the chocolate and white chocolate chips evenly throughout the batter.

Assemble the loaf: Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula or knife. Sprinkle generously with more chocolate chips. 

Bake: Place the pan on an aluminum baking sheet or tray, and bake for 50-60 minutes. The loaf should double, and the top will turn golden brown. Check for doneness around the 50-minute mark by inserting a toothpick or knife into the center; it should come out clean or with a few crumbs. If necessary, bake in additional 5-minute intervals until done.

Storage:
At room temperature: Once cooled, wrap any leftovers tightly in plastic wrap or foil, or place them in an airtight container. It will keep for up to 5 days at room temperature, as long as the environment isn’t too warm.
In the fridge: The loaf can also be refrigerated for up to 7 days.
To freeze: Slice the bread and separate the slices with parchment paper. Wrap well or place them in a sealed container. Freeze for up to 1 month. To defrost, let the slices thaw at room temperature for a couple of hours.
